titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Ryszard Wraga Papers, 1947-1959
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Reports, memoranda, and other writings, relating to post-World War II politics in the Soviet Union and Poland, American and Soviet intelligence and propaganda activities, and activities of Russian and Ukrainian emigre groups. Many of the documents were prepared for the French intelligence service
did.langmaterial: Russian, Polish, French, German and English.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ryszard Wraga Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Born Jerzy Antoni Niezbrzycki in Niemirov, Ukraine
Degree in law; graduate work in geography and philosophy, University of Warsaw

chronitem.event: Polish diplomatic service, Moscow and Kiev
Director of Eastern Section of Polish military intelligence; member, faculty of Polish Military Academy and Institute of Journalism
Serves with Polish armed forces in Poland and the West
Resides in London; lectures at Polish Institute of Eastern Affairs and Free Polish University; becomes British subject and changes name to Ryszard Wraga
Resides in Paris; acts as consultant on Soviet Affairs to French Foreign Office Research Department
Emigrates to the U.S.; works at Library of Congress
Research Associate at Hoover Institution, Stanford University

scopecontent.p: Handwritten reports in Russian by Ryszard Wraga re the internal situation and foreign policy of China, West Germany, Poland, the Ukraine, the U.S.S.R. and Yugoslavia. Also includes material on the Communist Party of the U.S.S.R. Arranged alphabetically by topic. 1951-1956.

Reports, minutes of meetings, press releases and correspondence of Russian, East European and Caucasian post-war anti-Soviet organizations. Includes materials of the American Committee of Struggle for the Freedom of Nations, 1' Institut pour l'etude de l'histoire et de la culture de l'U.R.S.S., L.B.N.S., N.T.S., R.A.O., S.B.O.N.R., S.O.N.R. and the Wiesbaden Conference. Arranged alphabetically by organization. 1949-1952.

Includes series of lectures in Polish on Russian and East European topics, Kurs Spraw Wschodnich, Institut Blieskiego i Srodkowego Wschodu "Reduta", London, 1949. Also includes Intermarium Biuletyn, Srodkowo Europejski Klub Federalny w Rzyme, Rome, 1947; Sprawy Bialoruskie, London, 1951; Sprawy Ukrainskie, London, 1950-1952; Szkola Nauk Politycznkych i Spolecznych, London, 1951; Wschod Polski, Institut Wschodni "Reduta", London, 1950-1952.
Miscellaneous typescript reports, articles and documents re Poland, the Ukraine and the U.S.S.R. Arranged alphabetically by topic. 1918-1953.
